newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KLM and Dutch govt discuss KLM share sale.
newsitem.headline: KLM and Dutch govt discuss KLM share sale.

text.p: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines and the Dutch government on Monday confirmed they were in preliminary talks on the possible sale of part of the government's stake in the Dutch national carrier.
"The Dutch state and KLM confirm that orientation talks are currently being held on a possible partial sale of KLM shares by the state," the two said in a four-line joint statement.
"The talks are still at such an early stage that it would be premature to predict whether these talks would indeed lead to a sale of KLM shares by the state," the statement said.

KLM's annual report shows the government currently owns a 38.2 percent voting interest in KLM, comprising 25.7 million common shares, 11.8 million A-cumulative preference shares and 1,300 priority shares.
